page.title: 07St. Oswald's Church
page.content: By all accounts St. Oswalds Church has not always been so well cared for as it is today. In 1569 it was reported to the Gloucester Diocesan Consistary Court that the church possessed no surplice, that the Rector did not attend to his duties, and that the church was ruinous. Again there was cause to complain three years later, when the windows of both the nave and the chancel were unglazed, the mounds of the graves in the churchyard were in disrepair, there was no Parish Clerk and the Parson had lost the key, so the church door could not be locked. In 1902 the church was again restored, when the old gallery and the old box pews were replaced by new oak seats, the old pews being used for panelling.
